/* Discrimination Against Han Chinese */ Date fragments delinked.

/* Discrimination against city communities */ missing word ("of") inserted.
/* Discrimination against city communities */ Don't revert to your poor writing. I did not change meaning, just turned it into English and cut repetition and needless words.
/* Discrimination Against Han Chinese */ fix grammar, also you need to cite years
sorry for revert your edition.It sounds to cover the problem which the chinese people will encounter
/* Discrimination Against Han Chinese */ You are still confusing pop. growth differencres with fertility diffs. Former due to ethnic reidentification too.
/* Discrimination Against Han Chinese */ where the 42% come from? Stop embellishing and declaring a POV.
/* Discrimination against city communities */ You are making nothing out of nothing. What remains here is defensible.
/* Discrimination Against Han Chinese */ Adding sources for the city communities
It is the official discrimination,not just a '''difference'''
/* Gender-based birthrate disparity */ not nec word
/* Discrimination against city communities */ this is complete speculative POV, poorly written, and not documented at that
/* Discrimination against Han Chinese */ make statement more accurate; also eliminate Western POV in subtitle

/* Gender-based birthrate disparity */ RM undocumented speculation
/* China's Great Fertility Reduction: Family Planning and the Transition to a Market Economy */ Lowercased subsequent words in heading per [[Wikipedia:Naming conventions|house style]]
ctively disregarding PRC's sovereignty over the two special administrative regions. Both Hong Kong and Macau ARE constitutionally and practically part of the PRC.
ctively disregarding PRC's sovereignty over the two special administrative regions. Both Hong Kong and Macau ARE constitutionally and practically part of the PRC.
One-child policy is related only to mainland China, not the entire PRC. Please stop equating PRC and mainland China, effectively disregarding PRC's soverei
